greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: First term of maximal arithmetic progression with difference n, such that each term k has tau(k) = n.
comment: a(10) <= 43920665884407841463671 if A165498(10) = 5 (found by _Giovanni Resta_), and at least 1e12.
example: A165498(4) = 8, and exhaustive search finds tau(5989) = tau(5993) = tau(5997) = tau(6001) = tau(6005) = tau(6009) = tau(6013) = tau(6017) = 4 is the first example of an 8-term progression, so a(4) = 5989.
results.author: _Hugo van der Sanden_, Sep 21 2009; updated Nov 29 2016
